sen.j: 本願寺聖人伝絵（ほんがんじしょうにんでんね）とは、浄土真宗の宗祖親鸞の生涯を絵詞で記した仏教書。
sen.e: Honganji Shonin Denne is a Buddhist scroll which illustrates the life of Shinran, the founder of the Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) with narration.

sen.j: 親鸞の曾孫である本願寺第3世の覚如による著作。
sen.e: It was made by the third head priest of the Hongan-ji Temple, Kakunyo who was a great-grandchild of Shinran.

sen.j: 特に詩の部分は御伝鈔（ごでんしょう）、絵を御絵伝（ごえでん）という。
sen.e: In particular, the poetry part is called Godensho and the illustration is called Goeden.

sen.j: 親鸞の法要行事である報恩講にて拝読されている。
sen.e: It is read at the Hoon-ko, a memorial services for Shinran.

sen.j: 十三段からなる絵巻物であり、詞は覚如が撰述している。
sen.e: It is an illustrated scroll which is made up of thirteen-tier frames, and the narratives were compiled by Kakunyo.

sen.e: The illustration part is called Goeden and was drawn by Hogan JOGA.

sen.j: しかし建武3年（1336年）の戦火により本願寺と共に消失した。
sen.e: However, it was destroyed in the war in 1336, together with the Hongan-ji Temple.

sen.j: 次版本は康永2年（1343年）に覚如により書き直され、二段増補して十五段とした。
sen.e: The scroll of the second edition was written by Kakunyo in 1343 and the frames were increased by two tiers to fifteen tiers.

sen.j: また、詞と絵を別仕立てにし、御伝鈔（上巻・八段、下巻・七段）と御絵伝（縦型の四幅の掛軸）の体裁となった。
sen.e: Furthermore, it was separated into the narration and the illustration to form a set of Godensho (vol. 1 with eight paragraphs and vol. 2 with seven paragraphs) and Goeden (a set of four vertical scrolls).
